ironmongery.definition: the merchandise that is sold in an ironmonger's shop

irons.definition: metal shackles; for hands or legs

ironside.definition: a man of great strength or bravery

ironweed.definition: any of various plants of the genus Vernonia of tropical and warm regions of especially North America that take their name from their loose heads of purple to rose flowers that quickly take on a rusty hue

ironwood.definition: exceptionally tough or hard wood of any of a number of ironwood trees

ironwork.definition: work made of iron (gratings or rails or railings etc)

examples.en: the houses had much ornamental ironwork

ironworker.definition: a person who makes articles of iron

ironworks.definition: the workplace where iron is smelted or where iron goods are made

iroquoian.definition: a family of North American Indian languages spoken by the Iroquois

iroquois.definition: any member of the warlike North American Indian peoples formerly living in New York State; the Iroquois League were allies of the British during the American Revolution

irradiate.definition:
2) cast rays of light upon
3) expose to radiation

irradiation.definition:
1) the condition of being exposed to radiation
3) (physiology) the spread of sensory neural impulses in the cortex
4) the apparent enlargement of a bright object when viewed against a dark background

irrational.definition:
1) not consistent with or using reason
2) real but not expressible as the quotient of two integers

irrationality.definition: the state of being irrational; lacking powers of understanding

irrawaddy.definition: the main river of Myanmar rising in the north and flowing south through the length of Burma to empty into the Andaman Sea

irredeemable.definition: (of paper money) not convertible into coin at the pleasure of the holder

irredenta.definition: a region that is related ethnically or historically to one country but is controlled politically by another

irredentism.definition: the doctrine that irredenta should be controlled by the country to which they are ethnically or historically related

irreducible.definition: incapable of being made smaller or simpler

irregardless.definition: regardless; a combination of irrespective and regardless sometimes used humorously

irregular.definition:
1) contrary to rule or accepted order or general practice
2) not occurring at expected times
3) (used of the military) not belonging to or engaged in by regular army forces

irregularity.definition:
2) not characterized by a fixed principle or rate; at irregular intervals
3) an irregular asymmetry in shape; an irregular spatial pattern

irregularly.definition:
1) in an irregular manner
2) having an irregular form
3) in an irregular manner

irrelevance.definition: the lack of a relation of something to the matter at hand

irrelevant.definition: having no bearing on or connection with the subject at issue

examples.en: suddenly and irrelevantly, she asked him for money

irreligionist.definition: someone who is indifferent or hostile to religion

irreligiousness.definition: the quality of not being devout

irremediable.definition: impossible to remedy or correct or redress

irremovable.definition: incapable of being removed or away or dismiss

irreparable.definition: impossible to repair, rectify, or amend

irreparably.definition: in an irreparable manner or to an irreparable degree

examples.en: I admired his buoyancy and persistent good humor

irreproachably.definition: in an irreproachable and blameless manner

examples.en: she had lived blamelessly until she met this man
he could not explain the irreproducibility of the results of his experiment

irresistibility.definition: the quality of being overpowering and impossible to resist

irresistible.definition:
1) impossible to resist; overpowering
2) overpoweringly attractive

examples.en: what happens when an irresistible force meets an immovable object?

irresolute.definition: uncertain how to act or proceed

examples.en: the committee was timid and mediocre and irresolute

irresoluteness.definition: the trait of being irresolute; lacking firmness of purpose

irresponsibility.definition: a form of untrustworthiness; the trait of lacking a sense of responsibility and not feeling accountable for your actions

irresponsible.definition: showing lack of care for consequences

irretrievable.definition: impossible to recover or recoup or overcome

irreverence.definition:
1) an irreverent mental attitude
2) a disrespectful act

irreverent.definition: showing lack of due respect or veneration

irreverently.definition:
1) without respect
2) in an irreverent manner; clergymen had been turned from their cures, and churches irreverently used"

examples.en: the student irreverently mimicked the teacher in his presence
in the seventeenth century England had known fifty years of doctrinal quarrels and civil war

irreversibility.definition: the quality of being irreversible (once done it cannot be changed)

examples.en: this old tradition is irreversibly disappearing

irrevocable.definition: incapable of being retracted or revoked

examples.en: firm and irrevocable is my doom"- Shakespeare

irrigate.definition: supply with a constant flow or sprinkling of some liquid, for the purpose of cooling, cleansing, or disinfecting

irrigation.definition:
1) supplying dry land with water by means of ditches etc
2) (medicine) cleaning a wound or body organ by flushing or washing out with water or a medicated solution

irritant.definition: something that causes irritation and annoyance

examples.en: he's a thorn in my flesh

irritate.definition:
2) excite to an abnormal condition, or chafe or inflame
3) excite to some characteristic action or condition, such as motion, contraction, or nervous impulse, by the application of a stimulus

examples.en: irritate the glands of a leaf

irritating.definition:
2) (used of physical stimuli) serving to stimulate or excite
3) causing physical discomfort; they can be very painful"

examples.en: bites of black flies are more than irritating

irritation.definition:
1) the psychological state of being irritated or annoyed
3) (pathology) abnormal sensitivity to stimulation

examples.en: any food produced irritation of the stomach

irruption.definition:
1) a sudden violent entrance; a bursting in
2) a sudden sharp increase in the relative numbers of a population

examples.en: the recent irruption of bad manners

irruptive.definition: of igneous rock that has solidified beneath the earth's surface; granite or diorite or gabbro

irtish.definition: an Asian river that rises in the Altai Mountains in northern China and flows generally northwest to become a tributary of the Ob River

irving.definition:
1) United States writer remembered for his stories (1783-1859)
2) United States writer of darkly humorous novels (born in 1942)

isaac.definition: (Old Testament) the second patriarch; son of Abraham and Sarah who was offered by Abraham as a sacrifice to God; father of Jacob and Esau

isabella.definition: the queen of Castile whose marriage to Ferdinand of Aragon in 1469 marked the beginning of the modern state of Spain; they instituted the Spanish Inquisition in 1478 and sponsored the voyages of Christopher Columbus in 1492 (1451-1504)

isaiah.definition:
1) (Old Testament) the first of the major Hebrew prophets (8th century BC)
2) an Old Testament book consisting of Isaiah's prophecies

isatis.definition: Old World genus of annual to perennial herbs: woad

ischemia.definition: local anemia in a given body part sometimes resulting from vasoconstriction or thrombosis or embolism

ischemic.definition: relating to or affected by ischemia

ischia.definition: a volcanic island (part of Campania) in the Tyrrhenian Sea at the north end of the Bay of Naples

ischium.definition: one of the three sections of the hipbone; situated below the ilium

isentropic.definition: with unchanging entropy; at constant entropy

isere.definition: a river in southeastern France; a tributary of the Rhone

iseult.definition: (Middle Ages) the bride of the king of Cornwall who (according to legend) fell in love with the king's nephew (Tristan) after they mistakenly drank a love potion that left them eternally in love with each other

isfahan.definition: city in central Iran; former capital of Persia

isherwood.definition: United States writer (born in England) whose best known novels portray Berlin in the 1930's and who collaborated with W. H. Auden in writing plays in verse (1904-1986)

ishmael.definition: (Old Testament) the son of Abraham who was cast out after the birth of Isaac; considered the forebear of 12 Arabian tribes

ishtar.definition: Babylonian and Assyrian goddess of love and fertility and war; counterpart to the Phoenician Astarte

isis.definition: Egyptian goddess of fertility; daughter of Geb; sister and wife of Osiris

islay.definition: an island of western Scotland at the southern end of the Inner Hebrides

islam.definition:
1) the civilization of Muslims collectively which is governed by the Muslim religion
2) the monotheistic religious system of Muslims founded in Arabia in the 7th century and based on the teachings of Muhammad as laid down in the Koran

examples.en: Islam is predominant in northern Africa, the Middle East, Pakistan, and Indonesia
Islam is a complete way of life, not a Sunday religion
the term Muhammadanism is offensive to Muslims who believe that Allah, not Muhammad, founded their religion

islamabad.definition: the capital of Pakistan in the north on a plateau; the site was chosen in 1959

islamism.definition: a fundamentalist Islamic revivalist movement generally characterized by moral conservatism and the literal interpretation of the Koran and the attempt to implement Islamic values in all aspects of life

islamist.definition:
1) a scholar who knowledgeable in Islamic studies
2) an orthodox Muslim

islamize.definition:
1) cause to conform to Islamic law
2) convert to Islam

examples.en: The Mughals Islamized much of Northern India in the 16th century

island.definition:
1) a land mass (smaller than a continent) that is surrounded by water
2) a zone or area resembling an island

ismaili.definition: of or relating to a branch of Shiism that is noted for its esoteric philosophy

isoagglutination.definition: agglutination of an agglutinogen of one individual by a serum from another individual of the same species

isoagglutinin.definition: an antibody produced by one individual that causes agglutination of red blood cells in other individuals of the same species

isoagglutinogen.definition: an antigen capable of causing the production of (or reacting with) an isoagglutinin

isoantibody.definition: an antibody that occurs naturally against foreign tissues from a person of the same species

isobar.definition: (meteorology)an isogram connecting points having equal barometric pressure at a given time

isobutylene.definition: used also in making gasoline components

isochrone.definition: an isogram connecting points at which something occurs or arrives at the same time

isocyanate.definition: a salt or ester of isocyanic acid

isoetaceae.definition: quillworts; coextensive with the genus Isoetes

isoetales.definition: aquatic or marsh-growing fern allies; known to have existed since the Cenozoic; sometimes included in Lycopodiales

isoetes.definition: type and genus of the Isoetaceae and sole extant genus of the order Isoetales

isogamete.definition: either of a pair of conjugating gametes of the same size and structure

isogamy.definition: (biology) reproduction by the union or fusion of gametes of the same size and structure

isogram.definition: a line drawn on a map connecting points having the same numerical value of some variable

isohel.definition: an isogram connecting points receiving equal amounts of sunshine

isolable.definition: capable of being isolated or disjoined

isolate.definition:
1) place or set apart
2) obtain in pure form
4) separate (experiences) from the emotions relating to them

examples.en: They isolated the political prisoners from the other inmates
The chemist managed to isolate the compound

isolated.definition:
1) not close together in time
4) cut off or left behind
5) under forced isolation especially for health reasons

examples.en: several stranded fish in a tide pool

isolating.definition: relating to or being a language in which each word typically expresses a distinct idea and part of speech and syntactical relations are determined almost exclusively by word order and particles

isolation.definition:
1) a state of separation between persons or groups
2) a feeling of being disliked and alone
3) the act of isolating something; setting something apart from others

isolationism.definition: a policy of nonparticipation in international economic and political relations

isoleucine.definition: an essential amino acid found in proteins; isomeric with leucine

isomer.definition: a compound that exists in forms having different arrangements of atoms but the same molecular weight

isomerase.definition: an enzyme that catalyzes its substrate to an isomeric form

isomeric.definition: of or relating to or exhibiting isomerism

isomerism.definition: the state of being an isomer; the complex of chemical and physical phenomena characteristic of isomers

isomerization.definition: the conversion of a compound into an isomer of itself

isomerize.definition:
1) cause to change into an isomer
2) change into an isomer

isometry.definition:
1) the growth rates in different parts of a growing organism are the same
2) a one-to-one mapping of one metric space into another metric space that preserves the distances between each pair of points
3) equality of elevation above sea level

isometric.definition:
1) related by an isometry
2) of or involving muscular contraction in which tension increases while length remains constant
3) having equal dimensions or measurements

isometrics.definition: muscle-building exercises (or a system of musclebuilding exercises) involving muscular contractions against resistance without movement (the muscles contracts but the length of the muscle does not change)

isometropia.definition: equality of refractive power in the two eyes

isomorphism.definition: (biology) similarity or identity of form or shape or structure

isomorphous.definition: having similar appearance but genetically different

isoniazid.definition: antibacterial drug (trade name Nydrazid) used to treat tuberculosis

isopod.definition: any of various small terrestrial or aquatic crustaceans with seven pairs of legs adapted for crawling

isoproterenol.definition: drug (trade name Isuprel) used to treat bronchial asthma and to stimulate the heart

isoptera.definition: order of social insects that live in colonies, including: termites; often placed in subclass Exopterygota

isosceles.definition: (of a triangle) having two sides of equal length

isospondyli.definition: most primitive teleost fishes; all are soft-finned: salmon; trout; herring; shad; sardines; anchovies; whitefish; smelts; tarpon

isostasy.definition: (geology) a general equilibrium of the forces tending to elevate or depress the earth's crust

isotherm.definition: (meteorology) an isogram connecting points having the same temperature at a given time

isothermal.definition: of a process or change taking place at constant temperature

isothermic.definition: of or relating to an isotherm

isotonic.definition:
1) (used of solutions) having the same or equal osmotic pressure
2) relating to or characterized by the equal intervals of a musical scale
3) of or involving muscular contraction in which tension is constant while length changes

isotope.definition: one of two or more atoms with the same atomic number but with different numbers of neutrons

isotopic.definition: of or relating to or having the relation of an isotope

isotropy.definition: (physics) the property of being isotropic; having the same value when measured in different directions

israel.definition:
1) Jewish republic in southwestern Asia at eastern end of Mediterranean; formerly part of Palestine
2) an ancient kingdom of the Hebrew tribes at the southeastern end of the Mediterranean Sea; founded by Saul around 1025 BC and destroyed by the Assyrians in 721 BC

israeli.definition: of or relating to or characteristic of Israel or its people

israelite.definition: a native or inhabitant of the ancient kingdom of Israel

issachar.definition: (Old Testament) a son of Jacob and a forebear of one of the tribes of Israel

issue.definition:
1) an important question that is in dispute and must be settled
2) circulate or distribute or equip with
3) bring out an official document (such as a warrant)

examples.en: the issue could be settled by requiring public education for everyone
politicians never discuss the real issues
issue a new uniform to the children

issuer.definition: an institution that issues something (securities or publications or currency etc.)

issus.definition: a battle (333 BC) in which Alexander the Great defeated the Persians under Darius III

istanbul.definition: the largest city and former capital of Turkey; rebuilt on the site of ancient Byzantium by Constantine I in the fourth century; renamed Constantinople by Constantine who made it the capital of the Byzantine Empire; now the seat of the Eastern Orthodox Church

isthmian.definition: of or relating to or forming an isthmus

isthmus.definition:
1) a relatively narrow strip of land (with water on both sides) connecting two larger land areas
2) a cord-like tissue connecting two larger parts of an anatomical structure

isuridae.definition: in some classifications another name for the family Lamnidae

italy.definition: a republic in southern Europe on the Italian Peninsula; was the core of the Roman Republic and the Roman Empire between the 4th century BC and the 5th century AD

italian.definition:
1) of or pertaining to or characteristic of Italy or its people or culture or language
2) the Romance language spoken in Italy

italic.definition:
1) characterized by slanting characters
2) of or relating to the Italic languages
3) a typeface with letters slanting upward to the right

itch.definition:
2) have or perceive an itch
3) cause to perceive an itch
4) have a strong desire or urge to do something

examples.en: I'm itching--the air is so dry!
She is itching to start the project
He is spoiling for a fight

itchy.definition: causing an irritating cutaneous sensation; being affect with an itch

examples.en: he had an itchy toe from the mosquito bite

item.definition:
1) (used when listing or enumerating items) also
3) a whole individual unit; especially when included in a list or collection

examples.en: a length of chain, item a hook"-Philip Guedalla
they reduced the price on many items

itemize.definition: place on a list of items

iteration.definition:
1) (computer science) a single execution of a set of instructions that are to be repeated
2) (computer science) executing the same set of instructions a given number of times or until a specified result is obtained
3) doing or saying again; a repeated performance

examples.en: the solution took hundreds of iterations
the solution is obtained by iteration

ithaca.definition:
1) a college town in central New York on Lake Cayuga
2) a Greek island to the west of Greece; in Homeric legend Odysseus was its king

itinerant.definition: traveling from place to place to work

itinerate.definition: travel from place to place, as for work

itineration.definition: journeying from place to place preaching or lecturing; a preaching tour or lecturing tour

ives.definition:
1) United States composer noted for his innovative use of polytonality (1874-1954)
2) United States lithographer who (with his partner Nathaniel Currier) produced thousands of prints signed `Currier & Ives' (1824-1895)

ivy.definition: Old World vine with lobed evergreen leaves and black berrylike fruits

ivory.definition: a hard smooth ivory colored dentine that makes up most of the tusks of elephants and walruses

ivorybill.definition: large black-and-white woodpecker of southern United States and Cuba having an ivory bill; nearly extinct

iwo.definition: a bloody and prolonged operation on the island of Iwo Jima in which American marines landed and defeated Japanese defenders (February and March 1945)

ixia.definition: a monocotyledonous genus of the family Iridaceae

ixodes.definition: type genus of the family Ixodidae

izanagi.definition: the god who fathered the islands and gods of Japan with his sister Izanami

izanami.definition: sister and consort of Izanami; mother of the islands and gods of Japan

izar.definition: a voluminous cotton outer garment (usually white) traditionally worn by Muslim women of northern Africa and the Middle East; covers the entire body

izmir.definition: a port city in western Turkey
